page.title: 08Footpaths _ A Ramblers View
page.content: {FOOTPATHS - A RAMBLERS VIEW} Currently the map shows the area to contain 2 miles of Bridleway & 6.25 miles of Footpath, with the status of recognised Rights of Way. Little has been done to preserve the unique & valuable benefits of this important part of this country's heritage. Cooperation with the landowners is needed to help clear obstructions & replace footbridges & stiles to enable more to appreciate the countryside. The Highway Authority has a specific duty to erect & maintain a signpost at every point where a footpath, bridle- way or byway leaves a metalled road. There are 3 place where a Bridleway sign might appear; in fact there is only one. There are 27 footpaths joining metalled roads in the area; only 2 are signposted. There is 1 Green Lane & 2 Byway signposts.
